tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: SA Index
tlv.value: Index which AAA Server assigns to an SA.

tlv.name: Service Authorization Code
tlv.value: Code indicating whether or not service is authorized0 = service authorized1 = service not authorized

tlv.name: REG Context
tlv.description: MS REG context parameters that has been agreed between MS and BS and delivered in REG-RSP message during the initial network entry of MS.

tlv.name: Number of UL Transport CIDs Support
Number of DL Transport CIDs Support
Classification/PHS Options and SDU Encapsulation Support
Total Number of Provisioned Service Flows
Maximum amount of MAC Level Data per DL Frame Support
Maximum amount of MAC Level Data per UL Frame Support
Maximum Number of Bursts Transmitted Concurrently to the MS
Idle Mode Timeout
tlv.description: This IE is defined in the IEEE 802.16e spec

tlv.name: MS HO Connections Parameters Proc Time
SBC Context
tlv.description: MS SBC context parameters that has been agreed between MS and BS and delivered in SBC-RSP message during the initial network entry of MS.

tlv.name: Capabilities for Construction and Transmission of MAC PDUs
Maximum Number of Supported Security Associations
Authorization Policy Support
tlv.value: Refer to 11.8.4.2 Authorization policy support in 802.16e.Bit #0 = RSA-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #1 = EAP-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #2 = Authenticated EAP-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #3 = Reserved. Set to 0Bit #4 = RSA-based authorization at reentryBit #5 = EAP-based authorization at reentryBit #6 = Authenticated EAP-based authorization at reentryBit #7 = Reserved; shall be set to 0
tlv.description: This parameter is used to indicate authentication mode. In MS Security History TLV, it indicates the capability negotiated between ASN and MS.

tlv.name: The number of UL HARQ Channel
The number of DL HARQ Channels
HARQ Chase Combining and CC-IR Buffer Capability
OFDMA SS Uplink Power Control Support
OFDMA SS Uplink Power Control Scheme Switching Delay
Maximum Number of Burst per Frame Capability in HARQ
OFDMA SS demodulator for MIMO Support
OFDMA SS modulator for MIMO Support
OFDMA Parameters Sets
tlv.value: 8-bit bitmask
tlv.description: Identifies the profile of the capabilities of the MS negotiated during SBC handshake Bit#0 = Support OFDMA PHY parameter set A Bit#1 = Support OFDMA PHY parameter set B Bit#2-#4 = HARQ parameters set? 0b000 = HARQ set 1? 0b001 = HARQ set 2? 0b010 = HARQ set 3? 0b011 = HARQ set 4? 0b100 = HARQ set 5? 0b101-0b111 = Reserved Bit#5 = Support OFDMA MAC parameters set A Bit#6 = Support OFDMA MAC parameters set B Bit#7 = ReservedNote: Bit#0 and #1 SHALL not be set to 1 together. Bit#5 and #6 SHALL not be set to 1 together.

tlv.name: Anchor MM Context
tlv.description: Information related with FA relocation, which means all context maintained by some entities binding with FA relocation
tlv.msgPrimitives: Anchor DPF HO Request, Anchor DPF Relocate Request, R4 HO Request

tlv.name: MS Mobility Mode
tlv.value: Indicates the R3 mobility the MS is using: 00 = PMIP401 = CMIP410 = CMIP611 = Reserved

tlv.name: MIP4 Info
tlv.description: MIP4 Information about the MS

tlv.name: HA IP Address
tlv.value: IP address of HA.The Identifier might be in format of either 4-octet IPv4 Address or 16-octet IPv6 Address.The length defines also the format of the Identifier.

tlv.name: Home Address
tlv.value: Home Address (HoA) of the MS

tlv.name: Care Of Address
tlv.value: Care-Of Address (CoA) of the MS

tlv.name: Registration Lifetime
tlv.value: Registration Lifetime as defined in RFC 3344
tlv.description: The remaining lifetime (measured in seconds).

tlv.name: DHCP Server List
tlv.description: List of DHCP servers.

tlv.name: DHCP Server Address
tlv.value: IPv4 address
tlv.description: IPv4 address of the DHCP server. This TLV SHALL be included in the Context_Rpt message (as part of DHCP Relay Info TLV) if Context Purpose Indicator TLV was set toDHCP-Relay-Info.This TLV may be included multiple times as part of the DHCP Server List TLV.
tlv.msgPrimitives: DHCP Relay Info and DHCP Server List

tlv.name: DHCP Proxy Info
tlv.description: Information about the DHCP Proxy

tlv.name: IP Remained Time
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer.
tlv.description: Remaining lease time for the assigned IP address. It is represented in unit of second.

tlv.name: Idle Mode Info
tlv.description: Indicates if the MS is in Idle state

tlv.name: Anchor PC ID
tlv.length: Variable (could be of three fixed sized: 4, 6 and 16 octets)
tlv.value: The Identifier might be in format of either 4-octet IPv4 Address, 6-octet IEEE 802.16 BSID or 16-octet IPv6 Address. The length defines also the format of the Identifier.
tlv.description: Unique identifier for the Paging Controller network entity, which administers paging activity for the MS while in Idle Mode and retains MS service and operationalinformation.

tlv.name: SF Info
tlv.description: Service Flow Description

tlv.name: Failure Indication
tlv.value: 0 = Unspecified Error Error Codes: 1-16 Message Header Failure Codes 1 = Incompatible Version Number 2 = Invalid Function Type 3 = Invalid Message Type 4 = Unknown MSID 5 = Transaction Failure 6 = Unknown Source Identifier 7 = Unknown Destination Identifier 8 = Invalid Message Header 9-15 = Reserved for Future UseError Codes: 16-31 General Message Body Failure Codes 16 = Invalid message format 17 = Mandatory TLV missing 18 = TLV Value Invalid 19 = Unsupported Options 20-31 = Reserved for Future UseError Codes: 32-47 Message Generic Failure Codes 32 = Timer expired without response 33-47 = Reserved for Future UseError Codes: 48-127 Message Specific Failure Codes 48 = Requested Context Unavailable 49 = Authorization Failure 50 = Registration Failure 51 = No Resources 52 = Failure by rejection of MS 53 = Authenticator relocated 54-127 = Reserved for Future Use(To be updated with sub section team specific error handling) Error codes: 128-254 are reserved for future use.Error Code 255 is reserved to indicate use of an error extension field.
tlv.description: Indicates the reason for failure of a previous request messageFailure indication should be the First TLV in a response message when it is failure forthe request message.

tlv.name: SFID
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer.
tlv.description: SFID definition as per 802.16

tlv.name: Reservation Action
tlv.value: The Action field is a 16 bit vector with the following meaning for each bit being set to?1?: Bit 15 (0x0001) = Create service flow Bit 14 (0x0002) = Admit service flow Bit 13 (0x0004) = Activate service flow Bit 12 (0x0008) = Modify service flow Bit 11 (0x0010) = Delete service flow Bits 0 - 10 = UndefinedMore than one of bits 13-15 MAY be set to 1 at the same time (for instance, create & admit, or create/admit/activate/ modify a service flow).
tlv.description: Identifies the requested resource reservation action

tlv.name: Reservation Result
tlv.value: Result can be one of the following:0x0000 = Successfully Created0x0001 = Request Denied - No resources0x0002 = Request Denied due to Policy0x0003 = Request Denied due to Requests for Other Flows Failed.0x0004 = Request Failed (Unspecified reason)0x0005 = Request Denied due to MS reasonOther = Reserved
tlv.description: Indicates the result of a Resource Reservation Request.

tlv.name: Direction
tlv.value: 0x0000 = For Uplink 0x0001 = For DownlinkOther = Reserved
tlv.description: Describes the unidirectional Service Flow direction (i.e. UL or DL).

tlv.name: CID
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer.
tlv.description: CID definition as per 802.16.

tlv.name: SAID
tlv.value: SAID definition as per 802.16.
tlv.description: The SAID is a 16-bit identifier for the SA

tlv.name: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description
tlv.description: Contains sub-elements representing Classification Rule Priority and Set of Classifiers functionally equivalent to those defined in 802.16. All parameters pertaining to a specific classification rule SHALL be included in the same Packet Classification Rule compound parameter. The TLV contains one packet classification rule.

tlv.name: Classification Rule Index
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: This TLV defines the index assigned to this classification rule. The index is unique per service flow
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Classification Rule Action
tlv.value: Classification Rule Action Code0 = Add Classification Rule1 = Replace Classification Rule2 = Delete Classification Rule
tlv.description: Add, replace or delete the classification Rule for the classification of a specific service flow
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Classification Rule Priority
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer.
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies the priority for the Classification Rule, which is used for determining the order of the Classification Rule. A higher value indicates higher priority. Classification Rules may have priorities in the range 0-255 with the default value being 0.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: IP TOS/DSCP Range and Mask
tlv.value: The value field is structured as follows: Lower Limit - 1 byte Higher Limit - 1 byte Mask - 1 byte
tlv.description: The values of the field specify the matching parameters for the IP type of service/DSCP [IETF RFC 2474] byte range and mask. An IP packet with IP type of service (ToS) byte value ?ip-tos? matches this parameter if tos-low less than or equal (ip-tos AND tos-mask) less than or equal tos-high. If this field is omitted, then comparison of the IP packet ToS byte for this entry is irrelevant.

tlv.name: Protocol
tlv.value: 8 bit integers, representing IP Protocol: protocol
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies a matching value for the IP Protocol field. For IPv6 (IETF RFC 2460), this refers to next header entry in the last header of the IP headerchain. The encoding of the value field is that defined by the IANA document ?ProtocolNumbers.? If this parameter is omitted, then comparison of the IP header Protocol fieldfor this entry is irrelevant.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule/ Media Flow Description

tlv.name: IP Source Address and Mask
tlv.value: An IP Source Address/Mask pairs: (Src1, Smask)
tlv.description: An IP source address and its corresponding address mask. An IP packet with IP source address ?ip-src? matches this parameter if Src = (ip-src AND Smask) . If this parameteris omitted, then comparison of the IP packet source address for this entry is irrelevant.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: IP Destination Address and Mask
tlv.value: An IP Destination Address/Mask pairs: (dst1, dmask).
tlv.description: An IP destination addresses and its corresponding address mask. An IP packet with IP destination address ?ip-dst? matches this parameter if Dst = (ip-dst AND Dmask). If thisparameter is omitted, then comparison of the IP packet destination address for this entryis irrelevant.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Protocol Source Port Range
tlv.value: Source Protocol Port Range: (SrcPortLow, SrcPortHigh),
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies a range of protocol source port values. Classifier rules with port numbers are protocol specific; i.e., a rule on port numbers without a protocolspecification SHALL not be defined. An IP packet with protocol port value ?SrcPort?matches this parameter if SrcPort is greater than or equal to SrcPortLow and SrcPort isless than or equal to SrcPortHigh. If this parameter is omitted, the protocol source port isirrelevant. This parameter is irrelevant for protocols without port numbers.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Protocol Destination Port Range
tlv.value: Destination Protocol Port Range: (DstPortLow, DstPortHigh),
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies a range of protocol destination port values. Classifier rules with port numbers are protocol specific; i.e., a rule on port numbers without aprotocol specification SHALL not be defined. An IP packet with protocol port value?DstPort? matches this parameter if DstPort is greater than or equal to DstPortLow andDstPort is less than or equal to DstPortHigh. If this parameter is omitted, the protocoldestination port is irrelevant. This parameter is irrelevant for protocols without portnumbers.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Associated PHSI
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: The Associated PHSI value. It SHALL be equal to the PHSI value of the corresponding PHS Rule.

tlv.name: Classification Result
tlv.value: 0 = None1 = Discard packet. Other - Reserved
tlv.description: The value of this field specifies an action associated with the classification rule. If it is present in the Packet Classification Rule, its action shall be applied on the packets that match this classification rule.

tlv.name: QoS Parameters
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains all Parameters pertaining to a specific QoS Description

tlv.name: BE Data Delivery Service
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains the QoS parameters relevant for BE Data Delivery Service. If included in QoS Parameters, it implies BE Scheduling Service for UL connections

tlv.name: Maximum Sustained Traffic Rate
tlv.value: 32-bit integer representing rate (in bits per second).
tlv.description: This parameter defines the peak information rate of the service. The rate is expressed in bits per second and pertains to the SDUs at the input to the system. Explicitly, this parameter does not include MAC overhead such as MAC headers or CRCs. This parameter does not limit the instantaneous rate of the service since this is governed by the physical attributes of the ingress port. If this parameter is omitted or set to zero, then there is no explicitly mandated maximum rate. This field specifies only a bound, not a guarantee that the rate is available. The algorithm for policing to this parameter is left to vendor differentiation and is outside the scope of the standard.
tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service BE Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Traffic Priority
tlv.value: 0 to 7 = Higher numbers indicate higher priority. Default 0.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the priority assigned to a service flow as it is defined for the Traffic Priority in IEEE802.16e [2]. Given two service flows identical inall QoS parameters besides priority, the higher priority service flow should be givenlower delay and higher buffering preference. For otherwise non-identical service flows,the priority parameter should not take precedence over any conflicting service flow QoSparameter. The specific algorithm for enforcing this parameter is not mandated here.

tlv.name: Request/Transmission Policy
tlv.value: 32-bit bitmask.Bit #0 = Service flow SHALL not use broadcast bandwidth request opportunities.Bit #1 = Reserved.Bit #2 = Service flow SHALL not piggyback requests with data. (Uplink only)Bit #3 = Service flow SHALL not fragment data.Bit #4 = Service flow SHALL not suppress payload headers (CS parameter)Bit #5 = Service flow SHALL not pack multiple SDUs (or fragments) into singleBit #6 = Service flow SHALL not include CRC in the MAC PDU.All other bit positions are reserved.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter provides the capability to specify certain attributes for the associated service flow. These attributes include options for PDU formation, and foruplink service flows, restrictions on the types of bandwidth request options that may beused. An attribute is enabled by setting the corresponding bit position to 1.

tlv.name: UGS Data Delivery Service
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains the QoS parameters relevant for UGS Data Delivery Service. If included in QoS Parameters, it implies UGS Scheduling Service for UL connections

tlv.name: Minimum Reserved Traffic Rate
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer representing rate (in bits per second).
tlv.description: This parameter specifies the minimum rate reserved for this service flow. The rate is expressed in bits per second and specifies the minimum amount of data to be transportedon behalf of the service flow when averaged over time. The specified rate SHALL onlybe honored when sufficient data is available for scheduling. When insufficient dataexists, the requirement imposed by this parameter SHALL be satisfied by assuring theavailable data is transmitted as soon as possible.

tlv.name: Maximum Latency
tlv.value: 32-bit integer specifies the maximum latency (in milliseconds)
tlv.description: Time period between the reception of a packet by the BS or MS on its network interface and the delivering the packet to the RF Interface of the peer device. If defined, this parameter represents a service commitment (or admission criteria) at the BS or MS and SHALL be guaranteed by the BS or MS. A BS or MS does not have to meet this service commitment for service flows that exceed their minimum reserved rate.
tlv.parentTLV: UGS Data Delivery Service ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Tolerated Jitter
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: This parameter represents the maximum delay variation (jitter) (in milliseconds).
tlv.parentTLV: UGS Data Delivery Service ERT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: SDU Size
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer. Default = 49
tlv.description: Represents the number of bytes in the fixed size SDU. This parameter may be used for a UGS service flow when the length of IP packets on the data plane is fixed and known inadvance (this is typically the case for flows generated by a specific codec).

tlv.name: Unsolicited Grant Interval
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer representing the grant interval (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the nominal interval between successive data grant opportunities for this service flow. This parameter may be used for a UGS and ERT-VRservice flow when the inter-arrival time of IP packets on the data plane is known inadvance (this is typically the case for flows generated by a specific codec).

tlv.name: Traffic Priority
tlv.value: 0 to 7 = Higher numbers indicate higher priority. Default 0.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the priority assigned to a service flow as it is defined for the Traffic Priority in IEEE802.16e [2]. Given two service flows identical inall QoS parameters besides priority, the higher priority service flow should be givenlower delay and higher buffering preference. For otherwise non-identical service flows,the priority parameter should not take precedence over any conflicting service flow QoSparameter. The specific algorithm for enforcing this parameter is not mandated here.

tlv.name: Request/Transmission Policy
tlv.value: 32-bit bitmask.Bit #0 = Service flow SHALL not use broadcast bandwidth request opportunities.Bit #1 = Reserved.Bit #2 = Service flow SHALL not piggyback requests with data. (Uplink only)Bit #3 = Service flow SHALL not fragment data.Bit #4 = Service flow SHALL not suppress payload headers (CS parameter)Bit #5 = Service flow SHALL not pack multiple SDUs (or fragments) into singleBit #6 = Service flow SHALL not include CRC in the MAC PDU.All other bit positions are reserved.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter provides the capability to specify certain attributes for the associated service flow. These attributes include options for PDU formation, and foruplink service flows, restrictions on the types of bandwidth request options that may beused. An attribute is enabled by setting the corresponding bit position to 1.

tlv.name: NRT-VR Data Delivery Service
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains the QoS parameters relevant for NRT-VR Data Delivery Service. If included in QoS Parameters, it implies nrtPS Scheduling Service for UL connections.

tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service BE Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Request/Transmission Policy
tlv.value: 32-bit bitmask.Bit #0 = Service flow SHALL not use broadcast bandwidth request opportunities.Bit #1 = Reserved.Bit #2 = Service flow SHALL not piggyback requests with data. (Uplink only)Bit #3 = Service flow SHALL not fragment data.Bit #4 = Service flow SHALL not suppress payload headers (CS parameter)Bit #5 = Service flow SHALL not pack multiple SDUs (or fragments) into singleBit #6 = Service flow SHALL not include CRC in the MAC PDU.All other bit positions are reserved.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter provides the capability to specify certain attributes for the associated service flow. These attributes include options for PDU formation, and foruplink service flows, restrictions on the types of bandwidth request options that may beused. An attribute is enabled by setting the corresponding bit position to 1.

tlv.name: Maximum Traffic Burst
tlv.value: 32-bit integer representing burst size (in bytes).
tlv.description: This parameter defines the maximum burst size that SHALL be accommodated for the service. Since the physical speed of ingress/egress ports, the air interface, and the backhaul will in general be greater than the maximum sustained traffic rate parameter for a service, this parameter describes the maximum continuous burst the system should accommodate for the service assuming the service is not currently using any of its available resources.
tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: RT-VR Data Delivery Service
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains the QoS parameters relevant for RT-VR Data Delivery Service. If included in QoS Parameters, it implies rtPS Scheduling Service for UL connections

tlv.parentTLV: UGS Data Delivery Service ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Unsolicited Polling Interval
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer representing the polling interval (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the maximal nominal interval between successive polling grants opportunities for this Service Flow.

tlv.name: Traffic Priority
tlv.value: 0 to 7 = Higher numbers indicate higher priority. Default 0.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the priority assigned to a service flow as it is defined for the Traffic Priority in IEEE802.16e [2]. tlv.name: Global Service Class Name
tlv.value: Global Service Class Name as defined in IEEE802.16e.
tlv.description: Provides an authorized QoS parameters set in a length optimized format.

tlv.name: Service Class Name
tlv.value: Service Class Name as defined in IEEE802.16e
tlv.description: ASCII string, which is known at the BS and which indirectly specifies a set of QoS Parameters.

tlv.name: Media Flow Type
tlv.value: The 1st octet is enumerator with the following values: 0 = Reserved1 = Voice over IP2 = Robust Browser 3 = Secure Browser/ VPN 4 = Streaming video on demand 5 = Streaming live TV 6 = Music and Photo Download 7 = Multi-player gaming 8 = Location-based services 9 = Text and Audio Books with Graphics 10 = Video Conversation 11 = Message 12 = Control13 = Data14 - 255 = Reserved
tlv.description: Describes the application type, used as a hint in admission decisions, for instance, VoIP, video, PTT, gaming, etc.

tlv.name: Media Flow Description in SDP Format
tlv.value: <SDP string> is encoded as specified in IETF RFC 2327
tlv.description: This is a variable length string having SDP information . The <SDP string> is encoded as specified in IETF RFC 2327

tlv.name: Reduced Resources Code
tlv.value: Value = Null, see Description
tlv.description: This code indicates that the requesting entity will accept reduced resources Code if the requested resources are not available. (TBD: encoding)

tlv.name: Data Integrity
tlv.value: 0x0 = No recommendation 0x1 = Data integrity requested 0x2 = Data delay jitter sensitive
tlv.description: Specifies, if data integrity is recommended. The value ?data integrity requested? advises the base station that mechanism like ARQ/HARQ are requested. The value ?data delay jitter sensitive? advises the base station that ARQ/HARQ may have negative effects.

tlv.name: Paging Preference
tlv.value: Refer to 802.16e section 11.13.30.
tlv.description: This parameter is a single bit indicator of an MS?s preference for the reception of paging advisory messages during idle mode. When set, it indicates that the BS may presentpaging advisory messages or other indicative messages to the MS when data SDUsbound for the MS are present while the MS is in idle mode.

tlv.name: CS Type
tlv.value: 0 = All CS Types1 = Packet, IPv42 = Packet, IPv63 = Packet, 802.34 = Packet, 802.1Q5 = Packet, IPv4over802.36 = Packet, IPv6over802.3
tlv.description: Indicates type of convergence layer between MS and BS.

tlv.name: Data Path Info
tlv.description: Data Path Description
tlv.parentTLV: SF Info (for per SF Data Path)

tlv.name: Data Path ID
tlv.value: Data Path Identifier (e.g. GRE Key)
tlv.description: Identifier for a data path.

tlv.name: Data Path Encapsulation Type
tlv.value: 1 = GRE2 = IP-in-IP3 = VLAN
tlv.description: Data Path Type

tlv.name: Data Path Type
tlv.value: Enumerator: {Type1, Type2}
tlv.description: Distinguishes between Type 1 and Type 2 datapaths.

tlv.name: Data Path Integrity Mechanism
tlv.value: Note: Possible values are out of scope of Release 1.0.0 and will be defined in a future release.

tlv.name: Tunnel Endpoint
tlv.value: Either IPv4 or IPv6 Address
tlv.description: Specifies the IP Address of the GRE tunnel associated with the Data Path. If omitted than the IP Address is defaulted to the Source Address of the sender of Path (Pre-) Registration Request

tlv.name: SDU Info
tlv.description: Information about an SDU involved in Data Path Integrity operations.

tlv.name: SDU SN
tlv.value: SDU Sequence Number (for Data Path Integrity operations)

tlv.name: SDU BSN Map
tlv.value: Bitmap expressing which Blocks of the SDU have been transmitted and/or acknowledged.

tlv.name: PHS Rule
tlv.description: Parameters associated with a PHS Rule. Omission means PHS is disabled.

tlv.name: PHSI
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: PHSI has a value between 1 and 255, which uniquely references the suppressed byte string. The index is unique per service flow. The uplink and downlink PHSI values are independent of each other.

tlv.name: PHSS
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: The value of this field is the total number of bytes in the header to be suppressed and then restored in a service flow that uses PHS. This TLV is used when a service flow isbeing created. For all packets that get classified and assigned to a service flow with PHS enabled, suppression SHALL be performed over the specified number of bytes as indicated by the PHSS and according to the PHSM. If this TLV is not included in a service flow definition, or is included with a value of 0 bytes, then PHS is disabled. A nonzero value indicates PHS is enabled.

tlv.name: PHSF
tlv.value: Byte string
tlv.description: String of bytes containing the header information to be suppressed

tlv.name: PHSM
tlv.value: Bit string
tlv.description: The value of this field is used to interpret the values in the PHSF. It is used at both the sending and receiving entities. The PHSM allows fields, such as sequence numbers or checksums (which vary in value), to be excluded from suppression with the constant bytes around them suppressed: Bit 0: 0 = Do not suppress first byte of the suppression field, 1 = Suppress first byteof the suppression field Bit 1: 0 = Do not suppress second byte of the suppression field, 1 = Suppresssecond byte of the suppression field Bit x: 0 = Do not suppress (x+1) byte of the suppression field, 1 = Suppress (x+1)byte of the suppression field.

tlv.name: PHSV
tlv.value: 0 = Verify 1 = Don?t verify
tlv.description: The value of this field indicates to the sending entity whether or not the packet header contents are to be verified prior to performing suppression. If PHSV is enabled, the sender SHALL compare the bytes in the packet header with the bytes in the PHSF that are to be suppressed as indicated by the PHSM.

tlv.name: PHS Rule Action
tlv.value: PHS Action Code 0 = Add PHS Rule 1 = Replace PHS Rule 2 = Delete PHS Rule 3 = Delete All PHS Rules

tlv.name: Accounting Extension
tlv.description: This parameter indicates information relevant for accounting. The operation and the application content provider determine the format and value of the Accounting Extension.

tlv.name: SA Descriptor
tlv.value: Compound TLV
tlv.description: Set of SA-related IEs

tlv.name: SAID
tlv.value: SAID definition as per 802.16.
tlv.description: The SAID is a 16-bit identifier for the SA

tlv.name: SA Type
tlv.value: Code identifying the value of SA-type as defined below.0 = Primary1 = Static2 = Dynamic3 - 127 = Reserved128 - 255 = Vendor Specific
tlv.description: Type of SA.

tlv.name: SA Service Type
tlv.value: 0 = Unicast Service 1 = Group Multicast Service 2 = MBS Service3 - 255 = Reserved
tlv.description: This attribute indicates service types of the corresponding SA type. This attribute SHALL be included only when the SA type is Static SA or Dynamic SA. The GTEK SHALL be used to encrypt connection for group multicast service. The MTK SHALL be used to encrypt connection for MBS service.

tlv.name: Cryptographic Suite
tlv.value: Cryptographic Suite allowed.0x00000 = No data encryption, no data authentication & 3-DES, 1280x010001 = CBC-Mode 56-bit DES, no data authentication & 3-DES, 1280x000002 = No data encryption, no data authentication & RSA, 10240x010002 = CBC-Mode 56-bit DES, no data authentication & RSA, 10240x020103 = CCM-Mode 128-bit AES, CCM-Mode, 128-bit, ECB mode AES with 128-bit key0x020104 = CCM-Mode 128bits AES, CCM-Mode, AES Key Wrap with 128-bit key0x030003 = CBC-Mode 128-bit AES, no data authentication, ECB mode AES with 128-bit key0x800003 = MBS CTR Mode 128 bits AES, no data authentication, AES ECB mode with 128-bit key0x800004 = MBS CTR mode 128 bits AES, no data authentication, AES Key Wrap with 128-bit keyAll remaining values Reserved
tlv.description: Indicates crytopgraphic suites allowed.

tlv.name: Older TEK Parameters
tlv.value: Compound TLV
tlv.description: Set of the Older TEK Parameters

tlv.name: TEK
tlv.value: 64-bit or 128-bit string
tlv.description: Traffic Encryption Key.
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: TEK SN
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer with valid values from 0 to 3.
tlv.description: 2-bit TEK Sequence Number.
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: TEK Lifetime
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: The remaining TEK Lifetime in seconds. Zero means that the corresponding TEK is not valid.
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: PN Counter
tlv.value: Unsigned 32-bit integer
tlv.description: Last value of PN Counter used on DL (for AES CCM cipher suite)
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: RxPN Counter
tlv.value: Unsigned 32-bit integer
tlv.description: Last value of PN Counter used on UL (for AES CCM cipher suite)
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: Newer TEK Parameters
tlv.value: Compund TLV
tlv.description: Set of the Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: TEK
tlv.value: 64-bit or 128-bit string
tlv.description: Traffic Encryption Key.
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: TEK SN
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer with valid values from 0 to 3.
tlv.description: 2-bit TEK Sequence Number.
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: TEK Lifetime
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: The remaining TEK Lifetime in seconds. Zero means that the corresponding TEK is not valid.
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: PN Counter
tlv.value: Unsigned 32-bit integer
tlv.description: Last value of PN Counter used on DL (for AES CCM cipher suite)
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: RxPN Counter
tlv.value: Unsigned 32-bit integer
tlv.description: Last value of PN Counter used on UL (for AES CCM cipher suite)
tlv.parentTLV: Older TEK Parameters, Newer TEK Parameters

tlv.name: SA Index
tlv.value: Index which AAA Server assigns to an SA.

tlv.name: Correlation ID
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: Indicates correlation between Service Flows. Service Flows with the same Correlation ID are assumed to be related on higher layers and may be treated with common policy. Correlation ID may be associated with SDFID on R3, or allocated locally at the ASN.

tlv.name: Data Delivery Trigger
tlv.value: 0 = No trigger1 = Triggers immediate delivery of data for the specified Service Flow
tlv.description: Triggers data delivery for the specified service flow

tlv.name: Tunnel Endpoint
tlv.value: Either IPv4 or IPv6 Address
tlv.description: Specifies the IP Address of the GRE tunnel associated with the Data Path. If omitted than the IP Address is defaulted to the Source Address of the sender of Path (Pre-) Registration Request

tlv.name: MS Security History
tlv.value: Compound TLV
tlv.description: Security parameters presenting the history of MS authentication

tlv.name: PMK SN
tlv.value: 0X0000 | 4-bit PMK SN
tlv.description: PMK Sequence Number as specified by IEEE 802.16e.

tlv.name: MS NAI
tlv.value: ASCII String
tlv.description: MS Network Access Identifier character string
tlv.parentTLV: MS Security History, MS Info, Context Request

tlv.name: Authorization Policy Support
tlv.value: Refer to 11.8.4.2 Authorization policy support in 802.16e.Bit #0 = RSA-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #1 = EAP-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #2 = Authenticated EAP-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #3 = Reserved. Set to 0Bit #4 = RSA-based authorization at reentryBit #5 = EAP-based authorization at reentryBit #6 = Authenticated EAP-based authorization at reentryBit #7 = Reserved; shall be set to 0
tlv.description: This parameter is used to indicate authentication mode. In MS Security History TLV, it indicates the capability negotiated between ASN and MS.

tlv.name: VAAA Realm
tlv.value: ASCII String
tlv.description: VAAA realm character string

tlv.name: VAAA IP Address
tlv.value: The length defines the format of this value - IPv4 or IPv6. The value with length of 4octets provides IPv4 address. The value with 16 octets provides IPv6 address.
tlv.description: VAAA IPv4 or IPv6 address.

tlv.name: MS NAI
tlv.value: ASCII String
tlv.description: MS Network Access Identifier character string
tlv.parentTLV: MS Security History, MS Info, Context Request

tlv.name: R3 Accounting Capabilities
tlv.value: 0x00 = No accounting. Only valid at the HA. 0x01 = IP-Session-based accounting. Default value for the ASN. 0x02 = Flow-based accounting
tlv.description: Accounting Capabilities

tlv.name: R3 Idle Notification Capabilities
tlv.value: 0x00 = Idle Mode notification is not supported or is not required. 0x01 = Idle Mode notification is supported or is required.
tlv.description: Idle notification Capabilities

tlv.name: R3 Framed IP Address
tlv.value: 32bits unsigned integer

tlv.name: R3 Framed IPv6 Prefix
tlv.value: 0-16 bytes

tlv.name: R3 AAA Session ID
tlv.description: AAA Session ID

tlv.name: R3 Packet Data Flow ID
tlv.value: Unsigned Short representing the flow identifier (most significant bit first). A value of zero(0) is invalid,
tlv.description: Packet data flow ID

tlv.name: R3 Service Data Flow ID
tlv.value: Unsigned Short representing the Service flow identifier (most significant bit first). This value is assigned by the home network and is unique per mobile session for the life of the session. A value of zero(0) is invalid.
tlv.description: Service data flow ID

tlv.name: R3 Service Profile ID
tlv.value: Unsigned Integer representing the identity of a Flow Spec that is pre-provisioned (most significant bit first). A value of zero(0) is invalid.
tlv.description: Service Profile ID

tlv.name: R3 Direction
tlv.value: 0 = Reserved1 = Uplink 2 = Downlink3 = Bi-directional4 - FF = Reserved

tlv.name: R3 Activation Trigger
tlv.value: 0x00 = Reserved0x01 = Provisioned (SHALL be set in case of ISF) 0x02 = Admit (SHALL be set in case of ISF) 0x04 = Activate (SHALL be set in case of ISF) 0x08 = Dynamically Changeable (not valid for ISF) 0x1z to 0x8z = Reserved
tlv.description: Activation Trigger

tlv.name: R3 Transport Type
tlv.value: 0 = Reserved1 = IPv4-CS2 = IPv6-CS3 = Ethernet4 - 255 = Reserved
tlv.description: Transport Type

tlv.name: R3 Uplink QoS ID
tlv.value: Unsigned Integer (most significant bit first) containing the ID of the QoS descriptor.
tlv.description: Uplink Qos ID

tlv.name: R3 Downlink QoS ID
tlv.value: Unsigned Integer (most significant bit first) containing the ID of the QoS descriptor.
tlv.description: Downlink Qos ID

tlv.name: R3 Uplink Classifier
tlv.value: String containing an IP-Filter Rule as pre RFC3588. Action is set to ?permit?.
tlv.description: Uplink Classifier

tlv.name: R3 Downlink Classifier
tlv.value: String containing an IP-Filter Rule as pre RFC3588. Action is set to ?permit?.
tlv.description: Downlink Classifier

tlv.name: R3 QoS ID
tlv.value: Unsigned Octet representing an ID
tlv.description: Qos ID

tlv.name: Global Service Class Name
tlv.value: Global Service Class Name as defined in IEEE802.16e.
tlv.description: Provides an authorized QoS parameters set in a length optimized format.

tlv.name: Service Class Name
tlv.value: Service Class Name as defined in IEEE802.16e
tlv.description: ASCII string, which is known at the BS and which indirectly specifies a set of QoS Parameters.

tlv.name: R3 Schedule Type
tlv.value: 0 = Reserved1 = Reserved2 = Best Effort3 = nrtPS4 = rtPS5 = Extended rtPS6 = UGS7 - 255 = Reserve
tlv.description: Schedule Type

tlv.name: Traffic Priority/QoS Priority
tlv.value: 0 to 7 = Higher numbers indicate higher priority. Default 0.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the priority assigned to a service flow as it is defined for the Traffic Priority in IEEE802.16e [2]. Given two service flows identical inall QoS parameters besides priority, the higher priority service flow should be givenlower delay and higher buffering preference. For otherwise non-identical service flows,the priority parameter should not take precedence over any conflicting service flow QoSparameter. The specific algorithm for enforcing this parameter is not mandated here.

tlv.name: Maximum Sustained Traffic Rate
tlv.value: 32-bit integer representing rate (in bits per second).
tlv.description: This parameter defines the peak information rate of the service. The rate is expressed in bits per second and pertains to the SDUs at the input to the system. Explicitly, this parameter does not include MAC overhead such as MAC headers or CRCs. This parameter does not limit the instantaneous rate of the service since this is governed by the physical attributes of the ingress port. If this parameter is omitted or set to zero, then there is no explicitly mandated maximum rate. This field specifies only a bound, not a guarantee that the rate is available. The algorithm for policing to this parameter is left to vendor differentiation and is outside the scope of the standard.
tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service BE Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Minimum Reserved Traffic Rate
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer representing rate (in bits per second).
tlv.description: This parameter specifies the minimum rate reserved for this service flow. The rate is expressed in bits per second and specifies the minimum amount of data to be transportedon behalf of the service flow when averaged over time. The specified rate SHALL onlybe honored when sufficient data is available for scheduling. When insufficient dataexists, the requirement imposed by this parameter SHALL be satisfied by assuring theavailable data is transmitted as soon as possible.

tlv.name: Maximum Traffic Burst
tlv.value: 32-bit integer representing burst size (in bytes).
tlv.description: This parameter defines the maximum burst size that SHALL be accommodated for the service. Since the physical speed of ingress/egress ports, the air interface, and the backhaul will in general be greater than the maximum sustained traffic rate parameter for a service, this parameter describes the maximum continuous burst the system should accommodate for the service assuming the service is not currently using any of its available resources.
tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Tolerated Jitter
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: This parameter represents the maximum delay variation (jitter) (in milliseconds).
tlv.parentTLV: UGS Data Delivery Service ERT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Maximum Latency
tlv.value: 32-bit integer specifies the maximum latency (in milliseconds)
tlv.description: Time period between the reception of a packet by the BS or MS on its network interface and the delivering the packet to the RF Interface of the peer device. If defined, this parameter represents a service commitment (or admission criteria) at the BS or MS and SHALL be guaranteed by the BS or MS. A BS or MS does not have to meet this service commitment for service flows that exceed their minimum reserved rate.
tlv.parentTLV: UGS Data Delivery Service ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Reduced Resources Code
tlv.value: Value = Null, see Description
tlv.description: This code indicates that the requesting entity will accept reduced resources Code if the requested resources are not available. (TBD: encoding)

tlv.name: Media Flow Type
tlv.value: The 1st octet is enumerator with the following values: 0 = Reserved1 = Voice over IP2 = Robust Browser 3 = Secure Browser/ VPN 4 = Streaming video on demand 5 = Streaming live TV 6 = Music and Photo Download 7 = Multi-player gaming 8 = Location-based services 9 = Text and Audio Books with Graphics 10 = Video Conversation 11 = Message 12 = Control13 = Data14 - 255 = Reserved
tlv.description: Describes the application type, used as a hint in admission decisions, for instance, VoIP, video, PTT, gaming, etc.

tlv.name: Unsolicited Grant Interval
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer representing the grant interval (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the nominal interval between successive data grant opportunities for this service flow. This parameter may be used for a UGS and ERT-VRservice flow when the inter-arrival time of IP packets on the data plane is known inadvance (this is typically the case for flows generated by a specific codec).

tlv.name: SDU Size
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer. Default = 49
tlv.description: Represents the number of bytes in the fixed size SDU. This parameter may be used for a UGS service flow when the length of IP packets on the data plane is fixed and known inadvance (this is typically the case for flows generated by a specific codec).

tlv.name: Unsolicited Polling Interval
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer representing the polling interval (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the maximal nominal interval between successive polling grants opportunities for this Service Flow.

tlv.name: R3 Acct Interim Interval
tlv.value: 32bits unsigned integer

tlv.name: MS Networking Context
tlv.description: Compound TLV

tlv.name: Authentication Result
tlv.value: The value of this parameter indicates to BS the results of EAP authentication process: 0 = Success 1 = FailureOther values are reserved.
tlv.description: Indication of EAP success

tlv.name: DHCP Relay Info
tlv.description: Information about the DHCP Relay. This TLV SHALL be included in the Context_Req and Context_Rpt messages if Context Purpose Indicator TLV is set to DHCP-Relay-Info

tlv.name: DHCP Server Address
tlv.value: IPv4 address
tlv.description: IPv4 address of the DHCP server. This TLV SHALL be included in the Context_Rpt message (as part of DHCP Relay Info TLV) if Context Purpose Indicator TLV was set toDHCP-Relay-Info.This TLV may be included multiple times as part of the DHCP Server List TLV.
tlv.msgPrimitives: DHCP Relay Info and DHCP Server List

tlv.name: DHCP Relay Address
tlv.value: IPv4 address
tlv.description: DHCP relay?s IPv4 address facing the DHCP server. This TLV SHALL be included in the Context_Req message (as part of DHCP Relay Info TLV) if Context PurposeIndicator TLV is set to DHCP-Relay-Info

tlv.name: DHCP Key
tlv.value: 160-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: Key used to calculate and authenticate messages between the DHCP relay in the ASN and DHCP server in the CSN, as per [31]. This TLV SHALL be included in the Context_Rpt message (as part of DHCP Relay Info TLV) if Context Purpose IndicatorTLV was set to DHCP-Relay-Info

tlv.name: DHCP Key ID
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: Key ID associated with the key used to compute authentication suboption as per [31]. This TLV SHALL be included in the Context_Rpt message (as part of DHCP Relay InfoTLV) if DHCP Key TLV is included.

tlv.name: DHCP Key Lifetime
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: The remaining lifetime in seconds of the DHCP key. This TLV SHALL be included in the Context_Rpt message (as part of DHCP Relay Info TLV) if DHCP Key TLV isincluded.

tlv.name: FA Relocation Indication
tlv.value: 0 = Success1 = Failure
tlv.description: Indicates the FA relocation process. It shall be set to indicate ?Success? if FA relocation has been Successfully completed with authenticator relocation. otherwise it should indicate ?Failure?

tlv.name: BS-originated EAP-Start Flag
tlv.description: Flag indicating that AR_EAP_Start message is originated by a BS (without receiving PKMv2 EAP-Start from an MS). A BS may use AR_EAP_Start with this flag to instigatereauthentication process when MS security context in BS is going to expire.

tlv.name: AK Context
tlv.description: Contains AK Context from Authenticator

tlv.name: AK
tlv.value: 160-bit AK Value
tlv.description: AK is derived from the PMK at the NAS.

tlv.name: AK ID
tlv.value: 64-bit AK ID Value
tlv.description: Identifies the AK that used for protecting the message

tlv.name: AK Lifetime
tlv.value: 32-bit AK Lifetime value in seconds
tlv.description: The time period during which the AK will be valid.

tlv.name: AK SN
tlv.value: 0X0000 | 4-bit AK SN
tlv.description: The Sequence number of root keys (PMK) for the AK.

tlv.name: CMAC_KEY_COUNT
tlv.value: Unsigned 16-bit integer
tlv.description: Value of the Entry Counter that is used to guarantee freshness of computed CMAC_KEY_* with every entry and provide replay protection. Upon initial networkentry, count is reset to 0 in the MS and Serving BS, and to 1 in the Authenticator.

tlv.name: MIP4 Info
tlv.description: MIP4 Information about the MS

tlv.name: HA IP Address
tlv.value: IP address of HA.The Identifier might be in format of either 4-octet IPv4 Address or 16-octet IPv6 Address.The length defines also the format of the Identifier.

tlv.name: Home Address
tlv.value: Home Address (HoA) of the MS

tlv.name: Care Of Address
tlv.value: Care-Of Address (CoA) of the MS

tlv.name: Registration Lifetime
tlv.value: Registration Lifetime as defined in RFC 3344
tlv.description: The remaining lifetime (measured in seconds).

tlv.name: CMAC_KEY_COUNT
tlv.value: Unsigned 16-bit integer
tlv.description: Value of the Entry Counter that is used to guarantee freshness of computed CMAC_KEY_* with every entry and provide replay protection. Upon initial networkentry, count is reset to 0 in the MS and Serving BS, and to 1 in the Authenticator.

tlv.name: Key Change Indicator
tlv.value: 0 = Success 1 = FailureOther values are reserved.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter indicates to ASN GW/Authenticator the results of PKMv2 3-way handshake process. Note, that BS indicates ?Success? results when it ensures thatMS had received PKMv2 SA-TEK-Response message and successfully enforced the newPMK/ AK contexts.

tlv.name: BS Info
tlv.description: Description of BS

tlv.name: BS ID
tlv.length: Variable (could be of three fixed sized: 4, 6 and 16 octets)
tlv.value: The Identifier might be in format of either 4-octet IPv4 Address, 6-octet IEEE 802.16 BSID or 16-octet IPv6 Address. The length defines also the format of the Identifier.
tlv.description: Unique BS Identifier, referring to a single sector with a single frequency assignment.

tlv.name: Serving/Target Indicator
tlv.value: Enumerator: The values are: 0x00 = Serving 0x01 = Target
tlv.description: Indicates if the designated BS is the Serving BS or Target BS for the handover.

tlv.name: Round Trip Delay
tlv.value: 8-bit integer representing Serving BS Round Trip Delay in the units of 1/Fs

tlv.name: Relative Delay
tlv.value: 8-bit integer representing Target BS Relative Delay in msecs.

tlv.name: DL PHY Quality Info
tlv.value: 32-bit integer encoding 8-bit DL RSSI Mean, 8-bit DL RSSI Std, 8-bit DL CINR Mean,8-bit DL CINR Std.

tlv.name: UL PHY Quality Info
tlv.value: 32-bit integer encoding 8-bit UL RSSI Mean, 8-bit UL RSSI Std, 8-bit UL CINR Mean,8-bit UL CINR Std.

tlv.name: Data Path Establishment Option
tlv.value: 0 = Do not (Pre-) Establish DP1 = (Pre-) Establish DP
tlv.description: A flag indicating whether or not Data Path SHOULD be (pre-)established by the entity hosting the Target HO Function (e.g. Target BS, Target ASN)

tlv.name: HO ID
tlv.description: This IE is defined in the IEEE 802.16e spec

tlv.name: HO Process Optimization
tlv.value: 8-bit integer representing HO Process Optimization code.

tlv.name: Authorization Policy Support
tlv.value: Refer to 11.8.4.2 Authorization policy support in 802.16e.Bit #0 = RSA-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #1 = EAP-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #2 = Authenticated EAP-based authorization at the initial network entryBit #3 = Reserved. Set to 0Bit #4 = RSA-based authorization at reentryBit #5 = EAP-based authorization at reentryBit #6 = Authenticated EAP-based authorization at reentryBit #7 = Reserved; shall be set to 0
tlv.description: This parameter is used to indicate authentication mode. In MS Security History TLV, it indicates the capability negotiated between ASN and MS.

tlv.name: Spare Capacity Indicator
tlv.value: 16-bit signed integer
tlv.description: The value defines how many MSs with certain Quality Of Service Parameters and certain PHY Quality Info may be accommodated.Negative value indicates that even the existing MSs suffer from degradation of service.

tlv.name: Service Level Prediction
tlv.value: 8-bit integer representing Service Level Prediction

tlv.name: Preamble Index/Sub-channel Index
tlv.value: 8-bit integer representing Preamble Index/Sub-channel Index

tlv.name: SF Info
tlv.description: Service Flow Description

tlv.name: Failure Indication
tlv.value: 0 = Unspecified Error Error Codes: 1-16 Message Header Failure Codes 1 = Incompatible Version Number 2 = Invalid Function Type 3 = Invalid Message Type 4 = Unknown MSID 5 = Transaction Failure 6 = Unknown Source Identifier 7 = Unknown Destination Identifier 8 = Invalid Message Header 9-15 = Reserved for Future UseError Codes: 16-31 General Message Body Failure Codes 16 = Invalid message format 17 = Mandatory TLV missing 18 = TLV Value Invalid 19 = Unsupported Options 20-31 = Reserved for Future UseError Codes: 32-47 Message Generic Failure Codes 32 = Timer expired without response 33-47 = Reserved for Future UseError Codes: 48-127 Message Specific Failure Codes 48 = Requested Context Unavailable 49 = Authorization Failure 50 = Registration Failure 51 = No Resources 52 = Failure by rejection of MS 53 = Authenticator relocated 54-127 = Reserved for Future Use(To be updated with sub section team specific error handling) Error codes: 128-254 are reserved for future use.Error Code 255 is reserved to indicate use of an error extension field.
tlv.description: Indicates the reason for failure of a previous request messageFailure indication should be the First TLV in a response message when it is failure forthe request message.

tlv.name: SFID
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer.
tlv.description: SFID definition as per 802.16

tlv.name: Reservation Action
tlv.value: The Action field is a 16 bit vector with the following meaning for each bit being set to?1?: Bit 15 (0x0001) = Create service flow Bit 14 (0x0002) = Admit service flow Bit 13 (0x0004) = Activate service flow Bit 12 (0x0008) = Modify service flow Bit 11 (0x0010) = Delete service flow Bits 0 - 10 = UndefinedMore than one of bits 13-15 MAY be set to 1 at the same time (for instance, create & admit, or create/admit/activate/ modify a service flow).
tlv.description: Identifies the requested resource reservation action

tlv.name: Reservation Result
tlv.value: Result can be one of the following:0x0000 = Successfully Created0x0001 = Request Denied - No resources0x0002 = Request Denied due to Policy0x0003 = Request Denied due to Requests for Other Flows Failed.0x0004 = Request Failed (Unspecified reason)0x0005 = Request Denied due to MS reasonOther = Reserved
tlv.description: Indicates the result of a Resource Reservation Request.

tlv.name: Direction
tlv.value: 0x0000 = For Uplink 0x0001 = For DownlinkOther = Reserved
tlv.description: Describes the unidirectional Service Flow direction (i.e. UL or DL).

tlv.name: CID
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer.
tlv.description: CID definition as per 802.16.

tlv.name: SAID
tlv.value: SAID definition as per 802.16.
tlv.description: The SAID is a 16-bit identifier for the SA

tlv.name: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description
tlv.description: Contains sub-elements representing Classification Rule Priority and Set of Classifiers functionally equivalent to those defined in 802.16. All parameters pertaining to a specific classification rule SHALL be included in the same Packet Classification Rule compound parameter. The TLV contains one packet classification rule.

tlv.name: Classification Rule Index
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: This TLV defines the index assigned to this classification rule. The index is unique per service flow
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Classification Rule Action
tlv.value: Classification Rule Action Code0 = Add Classification Rule1 = Replace Classification Rule2 = Delete Classification Rule
tlv.description: Add, replace or delete the classification Rule for the classification of a specific service flow
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Classification Rule Priority
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer.
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies the priority for the Classification Rule, which is used for determining the order of the Classification Rule. A higher value indicates higher priority. Classification Rules may have priorities in the range 0-255 with the default value being 0.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: IP TOS/DSCP Range and Mask
tlv.value: The value field is structured as follows: Lower Limit - 1 byte Higher Limit - 1 byte Mask - 1 byte
tlv.description: The values of the field specify the matching parameters for the IP type of service/DSCP [IETF RFC 2474] byte range and mask. An IP packet with IP type of service (ToS) byte value ?ip-tos? matches this parameter if tos-low less than or equal (ip-tos AND tos-mask) less than or equal tos-high. If this field is omitted, then comparison of the IP packet ToS byte for this entry is irrelevant.

tlv.name: Protocol
tlv.value: 8 bit integers, representing IP Protocol: protocol
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies a matching value for the IP Protocol field. For IPv6 (IETF RFC 2460), this refers to next header entry in the last header of the IP headerchain. The encoding of the value field is that defined by the IANA document ?ProtocolNumbers.? If this parameter is omitted, then comparison of the IP header Protocol fieldfor this entry is irrelevant.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule/ Media Flow Description

tlv.name: IP Source Address and Mask
tlv.value: An IP Source Address/Mask pairs: (Src1, Smask)
tlv.description: An IP source address and its corresponding address mask. An IP packet with IP source address ?ip-src? matches this parameter if Src = (ip-src AND Smask) . If this parameteris omitted, then comparison of the IP packet source address for this entry is irrelevant.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: IP Destination Address and Mask
tlv.value: An IP Destination Address/Mask pairs: (dst1, dmask).
tlv.description: An IP destination addresses and its corresponding address mask. An IP packet with IP destination address ?ip-dst? matches this parameter if Dst = (ip-dst AND Dmask). If thisparameter is omitted, then comparison of the IP packet destination address for this entryis irrelevant.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Protocol Source Port Range
tlv.value: Source Protocol Port Range: (SrcPortLow, SrcPortHigh),
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies a range of protocol source port values. Classifier rules with port numbers are protocol specific; i.e., a rule on port numbers without a protocolspecification SHALL not be defined. An IP packet with protocol port value ?SrcPort?matches this parameter if SrcPort is greater than or equal to SrcPortLow and SrcPort isless than or equal to SrcPortHigh. If this parameter is omitted, the protocol source port isirrelevant. This parameter is irrelevant for protocols without port numbers.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Protocol Destination Port Range
tlv.value: Destination Protocol Port Range: (DstPortLow, DstPortHigh),
tlv.description: The value of the field specifies a range of protocol destination port values. Classifier rules with port numbers are protocol specific; i.e., a rule on port numbers without aprotocol specification SHALL not be defined. An IP packet with protocol port value?DstPort? matches this parameter if DstPort is greater than or equal to DstPortLow andDstPort is less than or equal to DstPortHigh. If this parameter is omitted, the protocoldestination port is irrelevant. This parameter is irrelevant for protocols without portnumbers.
tlv.parentTLV: Packet Classification Rule / Media Flow Description

tlv.name: Associated PHSI
tlv.value: 8-bit unsigned integer
tlv.description: The Associated PHSI value. It SHALL be equal to the PHSI value of the corresponding PHS Rule.

tlv.name: Classification Result
tlv.value: 0 = None1 = Discard packet. Other - Reserved
tlv.description: The value of this field specifies an action associated with the classification rule. If it is present in the Packet Classification Rule, its action shall be applied on the packets that match this classification rule.

tlv.name: QoS Parameters
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains all Parameters pertaining to a specific QoS Description

tlv.name: BE Data Delivery Service
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains the QoS parameters relevant for BE Data Delivery Service. If included in QoS Parameters, it implies BE Scheduling Service for UL connections

tlv.name: Maximum Sustained Traffic Rate
tlv.value: 32-bit integer representing rate (in bits per second).
tlv.description: This parameter defines the peak information rate of the service. The rate is expressed in bits per second and pertains to the SDUs at the input to the system. Explicitly, this parameter does not include MAC overhead such as MAC headers or CRCs. This parameter does not limit the instantaneous rate of the service since this is governed by the physical attributes of the ingress port. If this parameter is omitted or set to zero, then there is no explicitly mandated maximum rate. This field specifies only a bound, not a guarantee that the rate is available. The algorithm for policing to this parameter is left to vendor differentiation and is outside the scope of the standard.
tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service BE Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Traffic Priority
tlv.value: 0 to 7 = Higher numbers indicate higher priority. Default 0.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the priority assigned to a service flow as it is defined for the Traffic Priority in IEEE802.16e [2]. Given two service flows identical inall QoS parameters besides priority, the higher priority service flow should be givenlower delay and higher buffering preference. For otherwise non-identical service flows,the priority parameter should not take precedence over any conflicting service flow QoSparameter. The specific algorithm for enforcing this parameter is not mandated here.

tlv.name: Request/Transmission Policy
tlv.value: 32-bit bitmask.Bit #0 = Service flow SHALL not use broadcast bandwidth request opportunities.Bit #1 = Reserved.Bit #2 = Service flow SHALL not piggyback requests with data. (Uplink only)Bit #3 = Service flow SHALL not fragment data.Bit #4 = Service flow SHALL not suppress payload headers (CS parameter)Bit #5 = Service flow SHALL not pack multiple SDUs (or fragments) into singleBit #6 = Service flow SHALL not include CRC in the MAC PDU.All other bit positions are reserved.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter provides the capability to specify certain attributes for the associated service flow. These attributes include options for PDU formation, and foruplink service flows, restrictions on the types of bandwidth request options that may beused. An attribute is enabled by setting the corresponding bit position to 1.

tlv.name: UGS Data Delivery Service
tlv.description: This compound TLV contains the QoS parameters relevant for UGS Data Delivery Service. If included in QoS Parameters, it implies UGS Scheduling Service for UL connections

tlv.name: Minimum Reserved Traffic Rate
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer representing rate (in bits per second).
tlv.description: This parameter specifies the minimum rate reserved for this service flow. The rate is expressed in bits per second and specifies the minimum amount of data to be transportedon behalf of the service flow when averaged over time. The specified rate SHALL onlybe honored when sufficient data is available for scheduling. When insufficient dataexists, the requirement imposed by this parameter SHALL be satisfied by assuring theavailable data is transmitted as soon as possible.

tlv.name: Maximum Latency
tlv.value: 32-bit integer specifies the maximum latency (in milliseconds)
tlv.description: Time period between the reception of a packet by the BS or MS on its network interface and the delivering the packet to the RF Interface of the peer device. If defined, this parameter represents a service commitment (or admission criteria) at the BS or MS and SHALL be guaranteed by the BS or MS. A BS or MS does not have to meet this service commitment for service flows that exceed their minimum reserved rate.
tlv.parentTLV: UGS Data Delivery Service ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: Tolerated Jitter
tlv.value: 32-bit unsigned integer (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: This parameter represents the maximum delay variation (jitter) (in milliseconds).
tlv.parentTLV: UGS Data Delivery Service ERT-VR Data Delivery Service

tlv.name: SDU Size
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer. Default = 49
tlv.description: Represents the number of bytes in the fixed size SDU. This parameter may be used for a UGS service flow when the length of IP packets on the data plane is fixed and known inadvance (this is typically the case for flows generated by a specific codec).

tlv.name: Unsolicited Grant Interval
tlv.value: 16-bit unsigned integer representing the grant interval (in milliseconds).
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the nominal interval between successive data grant opportunities for this service flow. This parameter may be used for a UGS and ERT-VRservice flow when the inter-arrival time of IP packets on the data plane is known inadvance (this is typically the case for flows generated by a specific codec).

tlv.name: Traffic Priority
tlv.value: 0 to 7 = Higher numbers indicate higher priority. Default 0.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter specifies the priority assigned to a service flow as it is defined for the Traffic Priority in IEEE802.16e [2]. Given two service flows identical inall QoS parameters besides priority, the higher priority service flow should be givenlower delay and higher buffering preference. For otherwise non-identical service flows,the priority parameter should not take precedence over any conflicting service flow QoSparameter. The specific algorithm for enforcing this parameter is not mandated here.

tlv.name: Maximum Sustained Traffic Rate
tlv.value: 32-bit integer representing rate (in bits per second).
tlv.description: This parameter defines the peak information rate of the service. The rate is expressed in bits per second and pertains to the SDUs at the input to the system. Explicitly, this parameter does not include MAC overhead such as MAC headers or CRCs. This parameter does not limit the instantaneous rate of the service since this is governed by the physical attributes of the ingress port. If this parameter is omitted or set to zero, then there is no explicitly mandated maximum rate. This field specifies only a bound, not a guarantee that the rate is available. The algorithm for policing to this parameter is left to vendor differentiation and is outside the scope of the standard.
tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service BE Data Delivery Service

tlv.value: 32-bit bitmask.Bit #0 = Service flow SHALL not use broadcast bandwidth request opportunities.Bit #1 = Reserved.Bit #2 = Service flow SHALL not piggyback requests with data. (Uplink only)Bit #3 = Service flow SHALL not fragment data.Bit #4 = Service flow SHALL not suppress payload headers (CS parameter)Bit #5 = Service flow SHALL not pack multiple SDUs (or fragments) into singleBit #6 = Service flow SHALL not include CRC in the MAC PDU.All other bit positions are reserved.
tlv.description: The value of this parameter provides the capability to specify certain attributes for the associated service flow. These attributes include options for PDU formation, and foruplink service flows, restrictions on the types of bandwidth request options that may beused. An attribute is enabled by setting the corresponding bit position to 1.

tlv.name: Maximum Traffic Burst
tlv.value: 32-bit integer representing burst size (in bytes).
tlv.description: This parameter defines the maximum burst size that SHALL be accommodated for the service. Since the physical speed of ingress/egress ports, the air interface, and the backhaul will in general be greater than the maximum sustained traffic rate parameter for a service, this parameter describes the maximum continuous burst the system should accommodate for the service assuming the service is not currently using any of its available resources.
tlv.parentTLV: ERT-VR Data Delivery Service RT-VR Data Delivery Service NRT-VR Data Delivery Service
